page.title: 17BBC TELEVISION STUDIOS
page.content: In 1984 the BBC took over this site from Central Television to relieve pressure on their London studios, particularly in the production of a twice weekly drama serial called {"Eastenders".}The building occupies premises dating back to early film making in 1914 together with a studio used by{Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.}to make programmes for American Television in the 1950's. There are now two full T.V. studios, two sound stages and complete technical facilities together with scenery and costume stores. There is also an outside lot of 1.4 acres on which a set of Victorian houses has been constructed for the Eastenders series. In addition to this serial, and other{light entertainment production, the studios are the centre of BBC television{training}courses.
